title: Report scrutinizes US efforts to rebuild post-quake Haiti
description: A federal audit has found that the U.S. Agency for International Development built only half of eight major projects meant to help Haiti recover from a devastating 2010 earthquake

title: Commander who gave interview about ill-trained Ukrainian troops was demoted, he says
description: The battalion commander, who goes by the call sign Kupol, spoke candidly to The Washington Post about the difficulties facing front-line Ukrainian units.

title: Loss of U.S. drone clipped by Russian jet was a twist in a broader pattern
description: The incident shone light on a fact of geopolitics that often receives little attention: Close calls between U.S. and Russian aircraft aren’t unusual.

title: Argentines struggle to make ends meet amid 100% inflation
description: Jesica Fernández used to join seven family members every weekend for a large beef barbeque

title: Prosecutor: Some of the 6 missing women in Mexico found dead
description: A prosecutor in Mexico says there is evidence that some of the six women who went missing on March 7 have been found dead

title: Vatican unveils new ethnographic display of Rwanda screens
description: The Vatican Museums has officially reopened its African and American ethnographic collections by showcasing intricately restored Rwandan raffia screens

title: Guatemala's government arrests another former prosecutor
description: The Guatemalan government has arrested former prosecutor Orlando Salvador López on abuse-of-authority charges

title: Pope sought to lose 'as little as possible' in London deal
description: The Vatican’s No. 3 says Pope Francis gave clear indications to get out of a disastrous London real estate deal at the heart of big criminal trial

title: 14-year-old boy arrested in Mexico for murder of 8
description: Mexican authorities have arrested a 14-year-old boy nicknamed “El Chapito” for the contract killing of eight people near Mexico City

title: 3 dead in rioting blamed on gangs in Brazil's northeast
description: National guard troops are patrolling northeastern Brazil after three nights of rioting allegedly ordered by imprisoned gang members that has left windows smashed, buses ablaze and at least three people dead

title: Top court ruling unleashes permit upheaval in Puerto Rico
description: A ruling by Puerto Rico’s Supreme Court has thrown into limbo hundreds of thousands of business and construction permits issued by a U.S. territory already struggling to attract investors amid an economic crisis

title: Adam Brody talks 'Shazam,' playing Leighton Meester's enemy
description: For Adam Brody, donning the padded superhero suit in “Shazam!”

title: Thai police to get mental health checks after fatal standoff
description: Police in Thailand will be subject to random checks of their physical and mental health after a 27-hour standoff where a senior officer holed up and fired a gun into the air until he was subdued by fellow officers

title: Comedian Trevor Noah wins prestigious Dutch Erasmus Prize
description: Comedian Trevor Noah, has won the prestigious Dutch Erasmus Prize

title: Palestinians: 4 killed in Israeli army raid in West Bank
description: Palestinian officials say an Israeli army raid has killed four Palestinians, including a teenage boy, near the occupied West Bank city of Jenin

title: 2 police officers killed in Canadian city of Edmonton
description: Edmonton police say two patrol officers were killed while responding to a call

title: Officials say 21 workers killed at coal mine in Colombia
description: Rescue operations at a coal mine in central Colombia that collapsed earlier this week have ended and officials say the accident had left 21 workers dead

title: In Rome, church and state agree to Pantheon entrance fee
description: Tourists in Rome checking out the Pantheon, Italy’s most-visited cultural site, will soon be charged a 5-euro ($5.28) entrance fee under an agreement between Italian culture and church officials

title: Poland says it will be first NATO country to give fighter jets to Ukraine
description: Polish President, Andrzej Duda said the country would deliver the first Soviet-made MiG-29s in the coming days.

title: Tanzania's first female president on visit to South Africa
description: Tanzania’s President Samia Suluhu Hassan, on a state visit to South Africa, has urged more security cooperation and trade between the two countries

title: Fire engulfs Russian border service building in Rostov-on-Don near Ukraine
description: Officials said at least one person died in an explosion and fire at a security service building. Russia's border regions are high alert for attacks, including drone strikes.

title: Sonko court appearance sparks unrest in Senegal's capital
description: Authorities have forcibly removed Senegal’s opposition leader Ousmane Sonko from his vehicle as he made his way to a court appearance

title: What to know about the Credit Suisse crisis and its global impact
description: Credit Suisse was granted a liquidity lifeline from the Swiss National Bank but fears of a market contagion remain in the wake of Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse.

title: UN-backed inquiry accuses Russia of war crimes in Ukraine
description: A U.N.-backed investigation has found that Russian attacks against civilians in Ukraine, including systematic torture and killing in occupied regions, amount to war crimes and possibly crimes against humanity

title: Several killed in mysterious northern Iraq helicopter crash
description: The counterterrorism agency of Iraq’s northern Kurdish-run region says several people were killed in a mysterious helicopter crash in northern Iraq

title: 2.5 tons of natural uranium are missing in Libya, U.N. watchdog says
description: Ten drums of natural uranium are missing, the International Atomic Energy Agency said, warning of potential nuclear safety concerns.

title: Russian security service building catches fire in Rostov
description: A building used by Russia’s Federal Security Service caught fire in the southern Russian city of Rostov, which is located about 70 kilometers (43 miles) from the border with Ukraine

title: Macron faces moment of truth as key vote on retirement age looms
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has been pushing for changes to the labor system since he was first elected.

title: With Russia visit, Xi pursues effort to upend U.S.-led global order
description: Buoyed after cementing his power in China and facilitating a deal between Iran and Saudi Arabia, Xi Jinping is set to visit Russia — and further tweak the U.S.

title: Lebanon’s Central Bank chief attends corruption questioning
description: Lebanon’s embattled Central Bank chief has appeared for questioning for the first time before a European legal team visiting Beirut in a money-laundering probe linked to the governor

title: Pakistani court extends pause in arresting ex-premier Khan
description: A Pakistani court is extending a pause in the effort to arrest former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a graft case

title: Blinken looks to restore ties in Ethiopia without glossing over war crimes
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with Abiy Ahmed and Tigray leaders, trying to balance President Biden’s pledge on human rights with strategic partnerships.

title: Dominican Republic sending children, pregnant migrants back to Haiti
description: As violence in the hemisphere's poorest nation intensifies, a crackdown on migrants in its nearest neighbor draws criticism from the United Nations and others.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. investigating ‘reckless’ drone incident; Kremlin aims to retrieve MQ-9 Reaper
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and Gen. Mark A. Milley, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, spoke to their counterparts in Russia. U.S. officials lauded Ukraine for holding Bakhmut.

title: Lebanon's empty schools bode long-term damage from crisis
description: Most of Lebanon’s children have not been in school for months

title: The Ukraine war is Antony Blinken’s defining moment
description: As President Biden’s secretary of state, Blinken has held Washington’s allies together. But navigating an end game to the crisis in Ukraine is proving elusive.

title: UN nuclear watchdog: 2.5 tons of uranium missing in Libya
description: Some 2.5 tons of natural uranium stored in a site in war-torn Libya have gone missing

title: Italy retrial ordered for Americans in killing of officer
description: Italy’s highest court has ordered a retrial for two American citizens who were convicted in the slaying of an Italian carabiniere during a sting operation gone bad

title: Live updates: Credit Suisse to tap up to $53.7B in loans; Asian markets down amid unease
description: Concerns of a global banking crisis eased slightly after Credit Suisse’s announcement, though the volatility led Asian equities to falter midday Thursday.

title: Exhibit: 'Invisible' Monet, Leon, was key to impressionism
description: Claude Monet’s older sibling is the focus of a landmark Paris exhibit illuminating the hitherto unknown role Leon Monet played in the French impressionist painter’s life and art

title: Israelis step up protests after Netanyahu rejects compromise
description: Israeli protesters are pressing on with demonstrations against a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: After Cyclone Freddy, flood risk lingers for southern Africa
description: After four days of destructive wind and rain, local communities and relief workers are now dealing with the aftermath of Cyclone Freddy which has killed more than 250 people and displaced tens of thousands of others across Malawi and Mozambique and may still cause further damage

title: The daring front-line mission to evacuate reluctant Ukrainians
description: The people still living in the most dangerous places in the war zone are often the hardest cases. Volunteers, working at high risk, try to persuade them to seek safety.

title: The United States and ICC have an awkward history
description: Both Washington and Moscow are united in their suspicion of the International Criminal Court, the world's most important investigator for war crimes.
